datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to high-adrenaline activities, risky sports, and extreme challenges.

columns.name: competitive_environment_preference
columns.description: Indicates if the participant prefers competitive events in extreme sports

columns.name: prefers_solo_events
columns.description: Indicates if the participant prefers solo over team events

columns.name: safety_gear_use
columns.description: Indicates the frequency of safety gear usage during events, ranked from 1 (always) to 5 (never)

columns.name: sport_engagement_period
columns.description: Indicates when the participant usually engages in extreme sports

columns.name: initiation_age
columns.description: Age at which participant started engaging in extreme sports

columns.name: years_of_experience
columns.description: The number of years the participant has been involved in extreme sports.

columns.name: adrenaline_level
columns.description: Self-reported adrenaline level during events on a scale from 1 to 10

columns.name: participation_in_peak_season
columns.description: Indicates if the participant frequently takes part in extreme sports events during the peak season.

columns.name: sport_specific_training
columns.description: Number of hours dedicated to training specifically for extreme sports per week

columns.name: annual_extreme_events
columns.description: Number of extreme sports events attended by the participant each year

columns.name: risky_maneuvers
columns.description: Indicates whether the participant regularly engages in risky maneuvers during events

columns.name: equipment_maintenance
columns.description: Number of times equipment is checked or maintained per month

columns.name: safety_training_level
columns.description: A numerical level representing the participant's level of safety training received for extreme sports

columns.name: location
columns.description: Location of regular training

columns.name: external_endorsements
columns.description: Count of sponsorships or external endorsements the participant has received

columns.name: risk_tolerance
columns.description: Rating of how much risk a participant is willing to take, graded from 1 to 10

columns.name: risk_aversion
columns.description: Risk aversion level from 1 (low) to 10 (high) indicating how likely a participant is to avoid risky activities

columns.name: sessions_per_week
columns.description: Number of training sessions per week

columns.name: number_of_past_injuries
columns.description: The total count of injuries the participant has sustained from extreme sports.

columns.name: previous_experience
columns.description: Number of years participant has been involved in extreme sports

columns.name: number_of_events
columns.description: Number of competitive events the participant engages in annually

columns.name: frequency_of_high_speed_sports
columns.description: The number of times a participant engages in high-speed sports per month

columns.name: number_of_injuries
columns.description: Total count of injuries a participant has had during their career in extreme sports

columns.name: overall_risk
columns.description: Participant's assessment of the overall risk involved in their activities, on a binary scale

columns.name: adrenaline_tier
columns.description: Categorizes participants by their adrenaline-seeking behavior into low, medium, or high

columns.name: number_of_extreme_sport_influencers_followed
columns.description: The number of extreme sport influencers a participant follows on social media

columns.name: expert_coaching
columns.description: Indicates whether the participant has access to expert coaching

columns.name: equipment_cost
columns.description: Average annual cost of sport equipment in USD

columns.name: recovery_time
columns.description: Average time taken for a participant to recover from injuries, measured in months

columns.name: preference_for_natural_scenery
columns.description: Indicates if the participant prefers to perform sports in natural settings like mountains or coastal areas

columns.name: number_of_indoor_activities
columns.description: The number of times a participant engages in indoor extreme sports per month

columns.name: age
columns.description: Age of the participant

columns.name: adherence_rate
columns.description: Percentage of adherence to training schedules

columns.name: number_of_sport_types
columns.description: Number of different extreme sports the participant is involved in

columns.name: custom_gear_ownership
columns.description: Indicates if the participant owns customized safety gear for extreme sports

columns.name: interest_in_technological_advancements
columns.description: Indicates if the participant has a high interest in technological advancements in sports gear

columns.name: repeat_participation
columns.description: Indicates if the participant repeatedly engages in the same extreme sport

columns.name: involvement_score
columns.description: Rating of how involved the participant is in the extreme sports community, on a scale from 1 to 10

columns.name: frequent_competitions
columns.description: Indicates if the participant frequently competes in extreme sports events

columns.name: number_of_outdoor_activities
columns.description: The number of times a participant engages in outdoor extreme sports per month

columns.name: successful_to_attempted_challenges
columns.description: Ratio of successfully completed challenges to attempted challenges

columns.name: types_of_sports_participated
columns.description: Count of different extreme sports the participant is actively involved in

columns.name: main_event_risk_level
columns.description: Categorizes the main extreme sport event in terms of risk level

columns.name: safety_equipment_importance
columns.description: Importance placed on using safety equipment while participating in extreme sports, rated from 1 to 10

columns.name: sport_type
columns.description: Type of extreme sport

columns.name: has_health_insurance
columns.description: Whether the participant has health insurance covering extreme sports related injuries

columns.name: outdoor_sports_preference
columns.description: Participant's preference for outdoor sports activities, rated from 1 to 10

columns.name: adjusted_adherence_rate
columns.description: Adjusted percentage of adherence to training schedules

columns.name: extreme_sport_events_attended
columns.description: Number of extreme sport events attended by the participant in a year

columns.name: career_oriented
columns.description: Whether the participant views extreme sports as a career (true) or just a hobby (false)

columns.name: age_group
columns.description: Categorical age group of the participant

queries.question: Is there a relationship between participants' safety training level, preference for high-speed sports, interest in technological advancements, and their choice of extreme sports?
queries.true_hypothesis: Participants with a safety training level of 7 or higher, a preference for high-speed sports, and a high interest in technological advancements are more likely to choose skydiving. Those with a lower safety training level but with a preference for natural scenery tend to select paragliding. Participants not meeting these criteria are more likely to choose bungee jumping.
